ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would only recommend it for students aiming for a Phd in Economics or Finance
I would advise since it provide an excel microeconomic background.
If you are an econ student you will have to take it. I'm sorry. Otherwise don't even think about it.
A standard first year graduate Micro course.Would recommend it, since it is essential for doing any type of more advanced work in Econ.
I would recommend Econ500 for other students with strong background on economics and math. The class provides a very good foundation in micro.
I wouldn't recommend taking it for fun, but if they're planning to apply to grad school or are interested in micro theory, than yes.
I'd recommend it, if you want to get a thorough technical training in microeconomics and are willing to invest the time.

This course is very helpful for an Economics students to build a solid foundation for future research. But too difficult for students who just want to add economic sense to his or her academic background.
- I would recommend it to econ students but not to others.
Yes, I would recommend it as it's a basic and solid course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I learned a lot but I could have learned much much much more if the teaching was better. I had to get tutors since the teaching was so bad and the TA's were terrible.
Very important course to help me with my research in applied microeconomics. I plan on studying economic development and I think this course is a must. Very helpful.
This course is helpful for me to understand economics logic and spirit of equilibrium.
Not much help. I wish there would be more the subject insights from professors.
